turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 2014–15 Montreal Canadiens season.
turn.1: What happened during the 2014-15 Montreal Canadiens season?
turn.2: On June 18, 2014, it was announced that hall of famer Guy Lapointe would be honored by having his number 5 jersey retired during the 2014–15 season.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Lapointe will become the 18th player to be honoured by the organization with jersey retirement and the second with the number 5, joining the late Bernie Geoffrion.
turn.5: What else did the team do?
turn.6: For only the second time in franchise history, the Canadiens did not name a captain, instead opting for four alternate captains for the season.
turn.8: On September 15, team management named Andrei Markov, Max Pacioretty, Tomas Plekanec and P. K. Subban alternative captains.
turn.9: What else did you find interesting about this season?
turn.10: The 2014–15 season also marked changes to television broadcast rights to the Canadiens; Réseau des sports renewed its French-language television rights to the team, agreeing to a 12-year extension.
turn.11: What were some of the highlights from this season?
turn.12: Due to Quebecor Media's exclusive national French-language broadcast rights to the NHL, RDS will now only be able to broadcast games in the team's blackout region of Quebec and eastern Canada.
